subject: Cybersecurity
title: Credential Stuffing: One Breach Unlocks Many Doors
description: A micro-lesson that makes Credential Stuffing: One Breach Unlocks Many Doors usable.

hook.text: You used the same email and password on a forum in 2015. That site was breached. Now attackers try it on every.

buildup.text: Credential stuffing uses breached username-password pairs to log into other services. Billions of credentials.

discovery.text: Automated tools test millions of credential pairs per hour across banking, email, and shopping sites. 0.1% success.

twist.text: Disney+ was hit by credential stuffing on its launch day. Thousands of accounts were compromised â€“ not because.

climax.text: Credential stuffing succeeds because 65% of people reuse passwords. One breach cascades across every service.

punchline.text: Your Netflix password is your bank password? So does the hacker know.

quiz.question: Why does credential stuffing work?
options: Most people reuse passwords across multiple services
Passwords are stored in plain text
